content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I actually made bot for this one.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: dakrhorse made a good.
I nicely used brain to constrate.
Jokes aside, engine is sound, gameplay is 100%, graphics are good.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It works well and is well tested. Congratulations on another great addition!
I think this is ready to be approved now, unless anyone has found any further issues?
* Uploaded a stronger boss
The boss has been updated. It can probably be made stronger if needed. My current bot in the leaderboard is also the boss in order to gather more games for evaluation.

Did a quick and dirty conversion from my othello meta mcts to test this game for early game branching. Will keep it updated. The reason it only shows 28 moves is symmetry. That symmetry is completely broken after the first move. It's 28 moves on turn 1, then 100+ moves on turn 2.

*  Thanks to the reviewers, fixed a severe bug in the inputs where the board was upside-down. This is likely to break some bots. Sorry about that.
* League 2 features now a 8 x 8 board
* Fixed a bug in the display

Haven't seen any malfunctions during making first approach.

I wonder what is starting player win ratio. In most  board games the player with first move has tempo advantage and  greater win ratio.

In kind of similar game 'cram' starting player can always win (prove by computer simulation , human player don't have such a skill yet)

* More updates on the statements
* Simplified comment interface
The graphical display sometimes displays both player moves as 'null', though they are correct in the game information panel.
The "random" command  used by the auto-generated code is not documented.

* Added french statement
* Updated english statement
* Some polish on UI

Although I intend to have only one version of the game, league level 2 now features a 10x10 board while level 1 keeps the 8x8 board. Depending on feedback, I'll make a choice between the two later on.

* Changed colors to lighter ones (it matches Breakthrough color chart)
* Decreased pawn moves speed
Nice. Wondered if anyone was going to do Clobber.

After a false start, here is the real thing. There are a few things left: logo, colors, fr statement, player UI polish, a decent boss.
It owes a lot to struct Amazons code (reused with his permission)
Sorry about that, my mistake, you should not have seen it. I picked the Amazons statement as a placeholder. However, give a favor to struct and copy your message to the Amazons contribution

Rules:
Typo: "once this games end" -> "once this game ends"


Legal action:
"any ammount of squares" should be "any number of squares" (only use "amount" for things that cannot be counted")
"it may not cross or go to a square occupied by a piece" should be "it may not cross or go to a square occupied by a piece OR occupied by a wall"
"the wall placement must meet the same requirements as the movement." - It is not clear from this whether the wall placement is relative to the piece's original position or the piece's new position.

Game Input:
"Next 10 lines: a string of characters representing one horizontal row of the grid, top to bottom." Is this always 10 lines, even when the board size is 8x8?

Output:
Typo: "...and where you wan to place the wall" (wan -> want)
Oops. I forgot to make it private. No, I am implementing Clobber using struct code as a basis courtesy of him

Hello darkhorse64,
Same game than amazons ?
done
As a novice player I would vote for smaller board. Even 8x8 on start, its too complicated to see what is going on on board.
French statement, English statement and a partially Polish UI? :P
Fixed
Fixed
Please do not summon jacek
